reviews.text:
I love rice noodles and the ones here are perfect. The texture is smooth and chewy in the best way. I always get the bone soup rice noodles and it hits the spot especially now that the weather is getting cooler.
I usually order for pickup and they package it really well. The noodles and soup are packed separately so the noodles donâ€™t get soggy. The price point is great and the portion is big. I usually save the other half for later. Super satisfying every time.
Will definitely come to dine in next time!

Flushing always surprises me. The noodles in this place are good. Iâ€™m surprised by the volume because itâ€™s HUGE. It is served in a pot like bowl, aka big. The classic soup noodles I ordered is light, satisfying and the noodles are fresh and chewy. Itâ€™s a very satisfying meal.

Loved it!! The broth here is so tasty and so well made. Loved how they list all the ingredients clearly on the menu.

Iâ€™m really confused why so many people spoke highly about the noodle soup here. I personally feel it is premade with too much spice to make the soup umami but let the customer thirsty.
Great food, but the size is on the smaller side for this location. I hope they invest in a bigger space.

Overall, I had a great experience at this restaurant. The food was tasty, the service was good, and everything looked clean. They seated me quickly, and the portions were huge â€” one dish is definitely enough for two people.

I ordered a tomato noodle soup, but I found it had way too many noodles and not enough vegetables or meat. Also, since most of the broths are pork-based, there arenâ€™t many options if you donâ€™t eat pork. I also tried the mushroom (wood ear) salad, which was fresh and delicious.

In short: the food is good and flavorful, but Iâ€™d love to see more balance with the soup (less noodles, more veggies and meat) and a few more non-pork soup options on the menu

Decided to stop in and was so excited they had Tom Yum noodles! My boyfriend ordered regular spice and I was a little worried, but it was delicious!! Like a slow burn but not too much to make it unenjoyable ğŸŒ¶ï¸ It was the perfect amount of spice and sour and I was in loveeee. If youâ€™re a Tom Yum enjoyer, this is a MUST ORDER! I believe you can pick seafood or beef, but it also had tofu skin, fungus, enoki mushrooms, (another white mushroom I forgot the name of ğŸ˜­), tomatoes, cabbage, quail egg, so much yummy stuff!
All my friends also enjoyed their meals except the friend who got the mala which was too spicy for them, but it still looked delicious!
I also liked that they hand you a tablet to order so thereâ€™s no need to stress and rush, just add what you want to cart and give it back to the servers!
The food came out fast and the portions were amazing for the price! I have another whole meal after eating as much as I could for only $16! The servers were friendly and packed our meals togo for us! ğŸ¥¹
There was also a promotion when we came in for buy 4 meals get 1 free so that was a pleasant surprise!
Iâ€™ll definately need to stop by again whenever Iâ€™m craving Tom Yum ğŸ¤¤

This is my go to spot for a wonderfully scrumptious noodle dish. Their food is always fresh and the portion is enough to keep me full. Itâ€™s conveniently located on Prince Street in the heart of Flushing. The service is excellent and you can tell by the satisfied customers. ğŸœ

Ordered spicy beef soup. Every piece of beef was gelatinous gristle.

Edit - went to Nan Xiang down the street, 1000% better beef. Go there if you actually want edible meat.
Un endroit Ã  ne pas manquer ğŸ˜ğŸ˜‹

I've been here several times and love their variety. Tried the laksa recently cuz of a craving and was slightly disappointed. It was watery and had little flavor. The eggs were severely overcooked. The tomato flavor here and the chicken maw is always good tho.
The servers however never pay attention. Always hudled together. I have to physically go up to grab their attention.

Lovely unassuming spot along Prince Street, amidst a bunch of bakeries and tea shops. Youâ€™ll find this near the Tangram mall.

Iâ€™ve been struggling to find a good noodle place that had /actual/ flavor and used not old-ish meat. So I was relieved to find this place. The portion size can be split generously within two people and even three if you order something with broth or soup. Do note though that the flavors are there & good but not strong. However, you can definitely change that with special instructions.

Staff was accommodating and patient. Place was not that big and would most likely have you waiting if itâ€™s the lunch/dinner rush. But well-maintained.

Canâ€™t wait to try the cold chicken slices and other appetizers.

I ordered the original bone soup rice noodles. The broth was extraordinarily mild, with each bite leaving something to be desired. I believe this is the kind of meal you would seek if you had a coldâ€”not overwhelming, but a gentle anecdote. However, I did not have a cold on this day, so perhaps a different menu option would have been better.
The food there is really good and the size of it is also great!

Rice noodles are a common specialty snack in southern China, famous for its unique flavor and rich taste.

Rice noodles are not only delicious but also nutritious, and are a favorite food for many people.

Really good portions, so fast and very tasty. My favorites were the pork intestine dry noodle and supreme chicken fish maw soup noodles
Authentic Chinese food in clean and casual setting. Has both spicy and non spicy food, ranging from noodles to appetizer meat platters. Great place!

A friend referred this place to me. The food was not great. I was not welcome in the store. It seemed a spot for locals and people who are ethnically the same.

Kids friendly environment, kids love cold cut chicken and bean curd sticks w. Spicy oil!!! Yummy food!!! Tired
Very good recommend the tomato soup noodles !
Food is great and delicious,Iâ€™ll come back again
Yummy food good service

Excellent gourmet food!every one should come to enjoy the food.
Place looks small and neat, nice little restaurant. The rice noodles are always delicious

Had a long layover at JFK so decided on this place based on Google Maps reviews. Easy to find and my meal and service were excellent. Photo of Tom Yum noodle soup. Ordering is through a menu Ipad with photos. Super easy and convenient to place your order. I will be back.

A newly renovated small restaurant in downtown Flushing. The location is very convenient (walking distance to train and subway, but no customer parking lot). The food was great. The soup base was tasty and not salty at all. The food portion was generous and we were filled and had a good amount of left over to pack up.  The only problem was the service. We sat down, placed our orders, received our orders, but we did not even offer hot tea or cold water. The waitress did not show up to check in with us at all during our meal. Other than the services, this was an enjoyable experience and the food was good.

Food was ok. Chicken was delicious.
BUTâ€¦
The staff was rude with us.
We arrived at the shop 9:50 pm
The didnâ€™t tell us that they are closing 10:20-10:30.
We ordered 4 plates for 2 people so we needed time to eat them.
They gave us the food quickly.

The guy that work there first he closes the one light behind us.
Then he closes the music.
In the end he asked as for tips in cash. I am a tourist so I donâ€™t have much cash with me in my last day there.

I do not recommend it.

This place was perfect on a cold day. We arrived before 6pm and there was no wait. The food came quickly and the warm rice noodle soup with sauerkraut and fish was rich and tasty. The cold cut chicken was also very tender and flavorful.
The service here is attentive, the dumplings in spicy oil are really good. The noodles come as a very large portion so had to take some home.

The sky was grey, the day chilly, my stomach begging for something filling and warm. We walked past this place and oh did the fragrance of the soups beckon!

It was love at first sip. Simple and plain.

The wife got the chicken and fish maw special, I the bone soup with beef.

Is it the best around? No. Is it the cheapest around? No. But I don't think you can get such nice soups and serving sizes at this price range anywhere else.

Give it a try, I didn't regret it.

Came here with my family as my brother insisted that we try. The waiter is so professional and friendly. We ordered 3 noodles soup and 2 appetizers. The noodles soup are so delicious. We also do 4 take outs after we dine in. I highly recommend this place. Thank you
The food was served really fast. The music is really good and the bathroom is clean. I like the tomato and beef rice soup
Sea food ramen a so excellent, wow long time ago I tried ramen so god

Very nice experience dining here. Maybe $15 for noodles. Service was great. Everything was clean except the sides of your bowl. Food was good. Portion was good. They blast the nice which is cold at first but once you start eating the hot noodles with a nice balance. Will come back

The best noodle place in Flushing! With excellent service, staffs are super patient with long time table service, we have several kids, noisy and dramatic, but they treat us well with respect and care, really appreciate it! Food quality is impressive and serving speed is awesome, less than 5 minutes after ordering, highly recommend!
Food was really good. We ordered the wings, bine broth soup and noodles with grounded pork. Plus a couple of drinks and everything was amazing. Would definitely be coming back.

I order three Rice Noodle,  Assorted Beef Sauce Mixed Ice noodles taste the best! It taste little spicy but I can still afford lol.

The second one I recommend would be Fish Soup Rice Noodle with Tofu & Basa Fish Slices. The mushroom soup is fresh and smell so good.

One of the top rated rice noodle in FlushingğŸ‘

Jibienchaun Noodles in Flushing is a hidden gem for hand-pulled noodle lovers. Their noodles are perfectly chewy, soaking up rich, flavorful broths like the deeply comforting beef noodle soup or the bold, spicy lamb. If you prefer something dry, the chili oil noodles pack a smoky, addictive punch. The space is small and no-frills, but the quick service and incredible flavors make it well worth a visit. For an affordable, satisfying bowl of noodles, Jibienchaun delivers every time.

We had the minced pork noodles, assorted beef mixed rice noodles  and fish soup rice noodles.  The food was fresh, tasty and plentiful.  The beef was well seasoned and perfectly cooked.  Water and hot tea were complimentary,   You are able to choose the spice level for your meal and add extra items to your dish for an additional price.  Prices are fair for the quality and amount of food served.  Staff are friendly and helpful.
You order by Ipad which is provided at the table upon arrival.
Payment is possible by tap to pay.
Restaurant was very cozy and clean.

One of the comfort food in flushing
I tried tomato beef shin soup noodles this time. The soup is rich with tomato flavor while the noodles is smooth as always!
This store is always a all time favorite for a quick and cosy meal ğŸ¥˜
It is my first time to try this restaurant, I am highly recommended the supreme fish maw chicken soup rice noodles, it is so delicious. I will come back. Thank you for the service.
Good service and price point! Food was really delicious and they have a great selection of soup and dry mixed noodles. Would come back here in the future and recommend for a quick meal in Flushing!

The noodle soup is very rich and delicious. I ordered fish with tomato base. The portions are very good and I left feeling extremely full. The service was great. I will definitely be coming back here again.

The chicken soup rice noodles are generous in portion, full of chicken and other ingredients, and delicious in flavor. The broth is fresh and savory. The chicken gizzard are well-seasoned, crisp, and tender. The "Family feast"assorted beef sauce mixed one also offers a large portion with a variety of ingredients, making it a great choice for a satisfying meal.
